author: time news
title: Cape Verde, first country qualified for the 8th after its victory against Mozambique
text: 2024-01-19 17:57:30 Cape Verde and Mozambique faced each other on Friday for the second day of group B of the 2024 African Cup of Nations (CAN). The Blue Sharks won (3-0) against the Mambas and won their ticket for the round of 16 of the competition. Published on: 01/19/2024 – 4:57 p.m. Modified on: 01/19/2024 – 5:11 p.m. 3 mn We now know the first qualifier for the round of 16 of the 2024 African Cup of Nations (CAN). After their victory (3-0) against Mozambique on Friday January 19 at the Félix-Houphouët-Boigny stadium in Abidjan – and five days after triumphing over Ghana – Cape Verde retains first place in Group B with six points. With his two victories, he also obtained his ticket for the round of 16 of the competition. From the start of the match, the Blue Sharks put pressure on the Mambas. In the 4th minute, the first strike of the match was from Deroy Duarte, but it was saved by Mambas goalkeeper Ernan Siluane. The following minutes saw the two teams neutralize each other. Few clear chances until a header from Duarte a quarter of an hour into the game, which nevertheless missed the Mozambican goals. We had to wait until the 24th minute to see the first big chance of the match. It is for the Blue Sharks, and signed Bebé. On a free kick located around thirty meters from the Siluane goal, the Rayo Vallecano striker chose to hit directly at goal, but saw his attempt crash into the crossbar. He decided to do it again less than ten minutes later, in the 32nd minute, this time, on a free kick located even further away – more than 40 meters away. Not even afraid. The Cape Verdean striker unleashes a floating and powerful shot which leaves Siluane no chance, allowing the Blue Sharks to open the scoring and Bebé to register, for the moment, undoubtedly the goal of the tournament. A style of free kick which recalls that of the Brazilian Juninho or the Portuguese Cristiano Ronaldo. The Mozambicans react in the 38th minute with Witiness Quembo. But his shot was caught without problem by Josimar Dias, the Cape Verde goalkeeper. The Mambas were however awarded a penalty in the 40th minute, but the referee, after consulting the VAR, finally decided to cancel it. At halftime, the Blue Sharks returned to the locker room with a one-goal advantage. Mendes and Pina ensure the qualification of the Blue Sharks The second half started with a bang for the Cape Verdeans with a goal from Ryan Mendes (51st) after a defensive error from Edmilson Dove, allowing the Blue Sharks to make the break. Less than ten minutes later (59th), the Mozambicans are on the verge of reducing the score and get their first big chance of the match. Geny Catamo hits a free kick directly with his left foot about twenty meters from the Cape Verdean goal, but sees his attempt die on the crossbar. The Blue Sharks bury the hopes of the Mambas in the 69th minute of play. Kevin Pina strikes thirty meters from the Siluane goal. The ball, powerful, landed in the net of the Mozambican goalkeeper, beaten for the third time in the game. The score will not change until the final whistle. Cape Verde won by a wide margin, becoming the first country to qualify for the round of 16. However, there is one match left for the Blue Sharks, Monday January 22, against Egypt. Mozambique will face Ghana on the same day. #Cape #Verde #country #qualified #8th #victory #Mozambique

author: https://www.lantidiplomatico.it
title: Se le relazioni sindacali annullano il potere di contrattazione
text:
Se le relazioni sindacali annullano il potere di contrattazione
419
di Federico Giusti
Negli anni la contrattazione sindacale è stata progressivamente svuotata delle sue prerogative e la bozza del nuovo CCNL Funzioni locali introduce novità che limiteranno il potere contrattuale effettivo con le materie dirimenti oggetto di informazione e di sterile consultazione che poi si tradurrà in farsa democratica per lasciare le Amministrazioni libere di agire sulla pelle della forza lavoro.
Siamo in presenza di un passaggio involutivo ulteriore, quello di trasformare la contrattazione di secondo livello nella mera applicazione di un contratto nel quale le materie da contrattare si ridurranno al fondo della produttività escludendo a priori i processi organizzativi e decisionali, non ci sarà alcun potere di veto da parte sindacale.
Le Rsu dovranno essere parte attiva nella armonizzazione tra la vita personale e le esigenze di lavoro, si concedono le delegazioni trattanti on line come grande conquista al fine di limitare i tempi dedicati alle attività sindacale. Non ci sono obblighi di percorsi formativi per il personale con un budget minimo dedicato al capitolo formazione, non esiste reale possibilità di incidere sulle mobilità, sulle dotazioni organiche, sui processi organizzativi che poi determinano anche la qualità della vita e del lavoro.
L'impianto contrattuale assegna spazi maggiori alla informazione preventiva che poi si traduce nel passaggio formale di decisioni assunte dalle Amministrazioni che dovranno essere recepite dal sindacato e a cui spetterà solo lo sterile compito di evidenziare qualche obiezione di forma senza mai incidere nella sostanza.
E le materie della cosiddetta gestione associata non riguarderanno gli aspetti organizzativi ma solo le politiche degli orari, la possibilità di accrescere il fondo del lavoro straordinario (manca il personale ma invece di assumerlo ricorreranno alle prestazioni oltre le 36 ore settimanali) . Da anni ormai, a colpi di decreti legge, hanno impoverito la stessa contrattazione sindacale, le organizzazioni firmatarie di contratto non hanno mai mosso obiezioni sostanziali a questi processi e si sono limitate a recepirle pensando di concertare processi decisionali che invece subiscono passivamente.
Per fare alcuni esempi pratici la programmazione del fabbisogno di personale, e quindi i piani occupazionali, saranno solo oggetto di informazione senza alcun obbligo di confronto reale con la parte sindacale.
A mero discapito delle RSU saranno implementate le competenze dell’organismo paritetico per l’innovazione che poi è l'ennesimo organismo formato con i sindacati firmatari di contratto a prescindere dalla loro reale rappresentatività a livello di Ente
In futuro i contratti decentrati potranno intervenire solo per circoscrivere i turni di reperibilità per un arco temporale trimestrale o sulla durata della pausa per la fruizione del buono pasto che ovviamente resta fermo ai miseri 7 euro con i quali si fa colazione o si acquista una bottiglia di acqua e un tramezzino. Manco sull'importo del buono pasto non ci sono iniziative per restituire dignità al ticket.
Sulla contrattazione di secondo livello, e quindi sul fondo della produttività di tutto il personale, scaricheranno gli oneri derivanti dal pagamento delle EQ e altri istituti contrattuali il cui importo potrà variare, pur nei limiti previsti dal contratto nazionale, scatenando l'ennesima battaglia tra poveri.
Si distribuiscono poi i classici contentini come stabilire entro aprile l'inizio delle trattative quando sappiamo che passeranno mesi per avere contezza sui fondi a disposizione, almeno la parte variabile aggiunta dalle amministrazioni in base agli obiettivi e agli indirizzi che le Amministrazioni offriranno alle Rsu.
Le assemblee sindacali potranno essere effettuate anche con modalità telematiche ma con durata massima di 3 ore, nel migliore dei casi questo tempo sarà calcolato ai fini della erogazione del buono pasto
Quanto emerge dalla bozza del CCNL Funzioni locali dimostra che non solo diminuisce il potere di contrattazione reale ma le RSU diventano i passacarte dei sindacati firmatari di contratto il che stride con i più elementari poteri democratici e di contrattazione.

author: leonardo-ceballos
title: Cuatro personas han sido asesinadas en el distrito Manta en menos de 24 horas | Seguridad | Noticias | El Universo
text: Cuatro personas han sido asesinadas en el Distrito Manta en menos de 24 horas. Tres de los crímenes se registraron en Manta y uno en Montecristi. La primera víctima fue Diego Armando Moncayo. Los sicarios lo sorprendieron el miércoles 27 de diciembre, a las 16:00, en el patio de una casa en el barrio Los Geranios. Allí realizaban trabajos de construcción. Luego en la madrugada de este jueves, 28 de diciembre, mataron a Sergio Andrés Pico Álava en la parroquia Eloy Alfaro. Él se hallaba en un velorio cuando los sicarios llegaron en un vehículo y empezaron a disparar contra quienes estaban en el lugar. El hecho dejó además una persona herida, que fue identificada como Yandry Elito A. Ch. Publicidad [Sicarios matan a tres hombres en el portal de una casa: Manta registra cinco asesinatos este fin de semana](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/seguridad/sicarios-matan-a-tres-hombres-en-el-portal-de-una-casa-manta-registra-cinco-asesinados-este-fin-de-semana-nota/) En el lugar donde ocurrieron los hechos se estaban velando los restos de Jorge Luis Mendoza Meza, quien fue acribillado el pasado martes, 26 de diciembre, dentro de una casa, donde también resultaron heridas otras tres personas. La tercera víctima es Ronald Ávila, quien fue hallado maniatado y golpeado con cables y piedras. Tenía antecedentes penales. Esto ocurrió en la parroquia Leonidas Proaño. [Dos muertos y un herido en ataque registrado en la vereda de una casa, en Manta](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/seguridad/dos-muertos-y-un-herido-en-ataque-registrado-en-la-vereda-de-una-casa-en-manta-nota/) La última víctima fue un taxista de nombres Bryan Pazmiño, quien fue baleado mientras transitaba por la vía Circunvalación. Él recibió varios disparos. Familiares llegaron primero a la escena y los trasladaron hasta el hospital Rafael Rodríguez Zambrano, donde solo comprobaron su muerte. Publicidad Alexandra Bravo, fiscal, indicó que se recogieron seis indicios balísticos, algunos ingresaron por la ventana. Reveló que la víctima tenía antecedentes penales. [‘Cómo te extraño, amor mío, son días duros’: la frase que bombero escribió a su esposa fallecida antes de ser asesinado en Manta](https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/seguridad/asesinan-a-bombero-en-manta-nota/) Emerson Luna, jefe de la Policía en Manta, señaló que realizan las investigaciones de estos hechos y ya hay resultados. Se han revisado cámaras de vigilancia de las zonas y se detuvo una persona vinculada al crimen ocurrido en la madrugada en la parroquia Eloy Alfaro. El sujeto tenía un arma. (I) Publicidad

author: ET Now
title: neeraj chadawar: PSUs will continue to ride momentum in 2024; 2 stocks to ace manufacturing cycle: Neeraj Chadawar - The Economic Times
text: Neeraj Chadawar, Head of Quant Strategy, Axis Securities: “We believe that in 2024, the entire PSU space will continue to ride its momentum. Right now the entire PSU space is having a 14% market cap as compared to the total market cap of the market which was earlier seen as 8% only and the historical average was 23%. So there is enough headroom available for PSU stock to go further from the current level also. There is a huge opportunity available to improve their market cap. Given the scenario of stable government and given the scenario of the capex led growth, we firmly believe that the entire PSU banking space is on the cusp of the cycle and there is a good amount of re-rating possible which was not earlier the case.” The growth opportunity or the addressable market when it comes to the manufacturing space is huge but don’t you think that the runup that we have seen in all the stocks, the valuations are quite expensive at this moment? Is it a good entry point for any new investor currently?Neeraj Chadawar: We are on the cusp of the big manufacturing cycle. The first leg of rally we are already seeing in the first leg of stock. Now we are identifying the stocks which are contributing to the ancillary demand of the manufacturing cycle. One stock which we identified is Amber Enterprises. Amber Enterprises has rightly introduced their product into fastest growing demand in the case of railway and the mobility space. Now they are contributing and making gang wagons and doors for the newly introduced Vande Bharat trainSo a company has also pointed out that this space is growing and they will double their expected revenue in next year which we believe that this space is very margin accretive and this will drive the EBITDA for the company in next two to three years. Based on this demand and the growth trajectory which they are seeing, we believe that this stock is very reasonably valued at this juncture and one can make a good entry point in Amber Enterprises at the current juncture. We foresee a Rs 3,700 target price in the next one year. The next is Sansera Engineering. This is an auto ancillary company and in over a year this company has de-risked its portfolio which was earlier concentrated into IC engines. Now they have de-risked their portfolio and entered into the fastest growing segment of EV, aerospace and defence. So all these segments are contributing high margin segment and which brings us the visibility for next couple of years where they will improve their return ratios and based on the demand momentum, we firmly believe that return ratios for this company are likely to improve in upcoming quarters and based on that we foresee a good amount of EPS growth in next three years and that will attract the good EBITDA margin improvement and ROE improvement. We set the target of Rs. 1210 for Sansera Engineering. One can make an entry in this stock with a good amount of potential of almost 20% from the current level.SBI is also one of your picks for 2024. Now we do understand that SBI has been a key laggard in 2023 and fundamentals continue to remain positive hence it could be an addition to your 2024 picks but why not any pick from a private banking space? HDFC bank has also been a laggard in 2023, right?Neeraj Chadawar: We believe that in 2024, the entire PSU space will continue to ride its momentum. Right now the entire PSU space is having a 14% market cap as compared to the total market cap of the market which was earlier seen as 8% only and the historical average was 23%. So there is enough headroom available for PSU stock to go further from the current level also. There is a huge opportunity available to improve their market cap. Given the scenario of stable government and given the scenario of the capex led growth, we firmly believe that the entire PSU banking space is on the cusp of the cycle and there is a good amount of re-rating possible which was not earlier the case. So given the scenario of a stable asset quality trend improving return ratios, we are foreseeing SBI to have an ROE of 16% so that makes a good bet to make an entry into the entire PSU banking space and we are confident about the growth levers for SBI.In the case of JK Lakshmi, you are seeing an upside of around 14% but of late, the cement space entirely if you see has been lagging with lower demand, prices have been on a downside and also raw metal prices have been quite volatile. So what is it that you are seeing will change for the cement companies in 2024?Neeraj Chadawar: For cement companies, H2 is likely to be brighter as compared to H1. The entire cement space is likely to see EBITDA per ton improvement as compared to H1, especially related to JK Lakshmi Cement. JK Lakshmi cement has a subsidiary in Udaipur and they are ramping up their facilities starting from Q1 FY25 which will contribute to their volume growth given tThat we are seeing a good amount of demand which is reviving in the infrastructure space and that is ramping up the volume growth. The company is well targeting to improve their EBITDA per ton starting from Rs 700 at present to Rs 950-970 in the next couple of years. This cost optimization practice and improvement in the EBITDA per ton makes a case of good improvement in the margin and good improvement to make an entry into this cement space. So that is why we firmly believe that currently the stock is trading at a reasonable valuation and we set a target of Rs 1000 for this stock in the next one year.Cyient is one of your IT picks, now there could have been more value in largecaps also, don’t you think so?Neeraj Chadawar: IT could be the good sector rotation theme in 2024 and it is likely to benefit more from the US interest rate cut which is likely to start from May-June 2024. Cyient is especially placed into the ER&D space that is the engineering research and development space and that space is continuously growing. We have seen multiple companies are catering into ER&D space and their demand is continuously rising because the end users are from the multiple industries and Cyient is playing a very significant role in playing a technology partner with all those players. So we believe that this is the fastest growing space along with that the aerospace demand is also increasing so they are also catering to that demand. So we firmly believe that there is a good amount of doubling the profitability in the next three years being the good revenue continues for the next three years. We firmly believe that this is a good place one can look at. This is the fastest growing company currently having a market cap of 25,000. If the company sustains their growth momentum, it is likely to get a mark of a mid-cap company also after the SEBI classification. So we believe that is possible in the next six months. We firmly believe that even the growth trajectory in ER&D space, this stock is a good place for the momentum growth.

author: Pamela Kaethner
title: Schule in Eberswalde: Kampf um ihren Lehrer - Schüler vom OSZ ziehen vor Kreistag
text:
Schule in Eberswalde: Kampf um ihren Lehrer – Schüler vom OSZ ziehen vor Kreistag
Die Schüler des beruflichen Gymnasiums am OSZ in Eberswalde kämpfen für ihren Abteilungsleiter und für Mitbestimmung. Im Kreistag finden sie Gehör, doch gibt es auch eine Lösung?
Eberswalde
Ein Artikel von

author: CNN Newsource
title: Cartels recruiting more teenagers to smuggle migrants in U.S.
text:
Cartels recruiting more teenagers to smuggle migrants in U.S.
By Lupita Murillo
Click here for updates on this story
TUCSON, Arizona (
KVOA) — Sheriff Mark Dannels tells News 4 Tucson that within the past 28 months, his department has detained over 3,000 individuals related to border issues.
Additionally, there have been nearly 500 high-speed pursuits.
The sheriff adds over 100 juveniles have been involved in Smuggling over that time.
One high-speed pursuit occurred in February involving a 15-year-old driver from Tucson operating a stolen vehicle.
According to Sheriff Dannels, the suspect was recruited by cartels via social media, with payments ranging from $800 to $1200 per person.
The chase unfolded on Highway 90, with speeds reaching up to 100 mph.
Sheriff Dannels stated that the 15-year-old will face trial as an adult. In the same timeframe, over 100 juveniles have been implicated in smuggling activities.
Sheriff Dannels says this is a daily problem that also includes adults.
“We cannot ignore it we all have to step up as leaders. Mayor’s sheriffs commissioners, governors United States if we don’t work together and politics to us, we’re never gonna solve this Problem.“ Dannels added.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.
